snippet: Ivy Baldwin Dance presented a new work, “Ambient Cowboy,” at New York Live Arts on Wednesday.
abstract: Brian Seibert reviews debut of dance piece Ambient Cowboy, choreographed by Ivy Baldwin and performed by Ivy Baldwin Dance company at New York Live Arts. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: ''Ambient Cowboy,'' a new work by Ivy Baldwin Dance that opened at New York Live Arts on Wednesday, begins with Ms. Baldwin and Lawrence Cassella on a bare stage. Bright lines emerge out of nowhere on the wall behind them, lengthening in free curves that spill over, surprisingly, onto the plane of the floor. Only when the lines are suddenly switched off does it become clear that they are made of light. In this production, the entire stage -- as well as the four dancers, who frequently enter and exit it -- serves as an Etch A Sketch for the projected doodles of someone in the audience. (It is the visual artist Anna Schuleit, never seen.) On Wednesday the doodler dramatically scribbled over the prostrate form of Eleanor Smith, maybe to highlight her, maybe to cross her out. Generally, though, the doodler was inactive for long periods, either engrossed or not paying attention.

headline.main: Performers to Fulfill a Doodler's Dream
